verses.kjv: And when they came nigh to Jerusalem, unto Bethphage and Bethany, at the mount of Olives, he sendeth forth two of his disciples,
verses.web: When they came near to Jerusalem, to Bethsphage and Bethany, at the Mount of Olives, he sent two of his disciples,
verses.ct: As they approached Jerusalem, near the villages of Bethphage and Bethany at the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent 2 of his disciples ahead.

verses.kjv: And saith unto them, Go your way into the village over against you: and as soon as ye be entered into it, ye shall find a colt tied, whereon never man sat; loose him, and bring him.
verses.web: and said to them, “Go your way into the village that is opposite you. Immediately as you enter into it, you will find a young donkey tied, on which no one has sat. Untie him, and bring him.
verses.ct: He told them, "Go into the village just ahead of you. As soon as you enter it, you'll find a young donkey tied up that no one has ever ridden. Untie it and bring it here."

verses.kjv: And if any man say unto you, Why do ye this? say ye that the Lord hath need of him; and straightway he will send him hither.
verses.web: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you doing this?’ say, ‘The Lord needs him;’ and immediately he will send him back here.”
verses.ct: "If anyone asks you, 'Why are you doing that?' just say, 'The Lord needs it,' and they'll send it right away."

verses.kjv: And they went their way, and found the colt tied by the door without in a place where two ways met; and they loose him.
verses.web: They went away, and found a young donkey tied at the door outside in the open street, and they untied him.
verses.ct: So they went and found the young donkey tied up by a door, out on the street where 2 roads met. They untied it.

verses.kjv: And certain of them that stood there said unto them, What do ye, loosing the colt?
verses.web: Some of those who stood there asked them, “What are you doing, untying the young donkey?”
verses.ct: Some people standing nearby asked them, "What are you doing, untying that donkey?"

verses.kjv: And they said unto them even as Jesus had commanded: and they let them go.
verses.web: They said to them just as Jesus had said, and they let them go.
verses.ct: They answered exactly as Jesus had told them to, and the people let them take it.

verses.kjv: And they brought the colt to Jesus, and cast their garments on him; and he sat upon him.
verses.web: They brought the young donkey to Jesus, and threw their garments on it, and Jesus sat on it.
verses.ct: They brought the donkey to Jesus and draped their cloaks over its back, and he sat on it.

verses.kjv: And many spread their garments in the way: and others cut down branches off the trees, and strawed them in the way.
verses.web: Many spread their garments on the way, and others were cutting down branches from the trees, and spreading them on the road.
verses.ct: Many people spread their cloaks on the road ahead of him, while others cut leafy branches from the trees and laid them along the path.

verses.kjv: And they that went before, and they that followed, cried, saying, Hosanna; Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord:
verses.web: Those who went in front, and those who followed, cried out, “Hosanna! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!
verses.ct: The crowds walking ahead of him and those following behind kept shouting, "Hosanna! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!"

verses.kjv: Blessed be the kingdom of our father David, that cometh in the name of the Lord: Hosanna in the highest.
verses.web: Blessed is the kingdom of our father David that is coming in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!”
verses.ct: "Blessed is the coming kingdom of our father David! Hosanna in the highest!"

verses.kjv: And Jesus entered into Jerusalem, and into the temple: and when he had looked round about upon all things, and now the eventide was come, he went out unto Bethany with the twelve.
verses.web: Jesus entered into the temple in Jerusalem. When he had looked around at everything, it being now evening, he went out to Bethany with the twelve.
verses.ct: Jesus entered Jerusalem and went into the temple. He looked around at everything, but since it was already evening, he left for Bethany with the 12 disciples.

verses.kjv: And on the morrow, when they were come from Bethany, he was hungry:
verses.web: The next day, when they had come out from Bethany, he was hungry.
verses.ct: The next day, as they were leaving Bethany, Jesus was hungry.

verses.kjv: And seeing a fig tree afar off having leaves, he came, if haply he might find any thing thereon: and when he came to it, he found nothing but leaves; for the time of figs was not yet.
verses.web: Seeing a fig tree afar off having leaves, he came to see if perhaps he might find anything on it. When he came to it, he found nothing but leaves, for it was not the season for figs.
verses.ct: He noticed a fig tree in the distance that was full of leaves, so he went over to see if it had any fruit. But when he reached it, he found nothing but leaves — it wasn't the season for figs.

verses.kjv: And Jesus answered and said unto it, No man eat fruit of thee hereafter for ever. And his disciples heard it.
verses.web: Jesus told it, “May no one ever eat fruit from you again!” and his disciples heard it.
verses.ct: Jesus said to the tree, "May no one ever eat fruit from you again." His disciples heard him say it.

verses.kjv: And they come to Jerusalem: and Jesus went into the temple, and began to cast out them that sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers, and the seats of them that sold doves;
verses.web: They came to Jerusalem, and Jesus entered into the temple, and began to throw out those who sold and those who bought in the temple, and overthrew the money changers’ tables, and the seats of those who sold the doves.
verses.ct: When they arrived in Jerusalem, Jesus went into the temple and began driving out the people who were buying and selling there. He flipped over the tables of the money changers and knocked over the chairs of those selling doves.

verses.kjv: And would not suffer that any man should carry any vessel through the temple.
verses.web: He would not allow anyone to carry a container through the temple.
verses.ct: He wouldn't even let anyone carry goods through the temple courts.

verses.kjv: And he taught, saying unto them, Is it not written, My house shall be called of all nations the house of prayer? but ye have made it a den of thieves.
verses.web: He taught, saying to them, “Isn’t it written, ‘My house will be called a house of prayer for all the nations?’ But you have made it a den of robbers!”
verses.ct: Then he taught them, saying, "Doesn't Scripture say, 'My house will be called a house of prayer for all nations'? But you've turned it into a den of thieves."

verses.kjv: And the scribes and chief priests heard it, and sought how they might destroy him: for they feared him, because all the people was astonished at his doctrine.
verses.web: The chief priests and the scribes heard it, and sought how they might destroy him. For they feared him, because all the multitude was astonished at his teaching.
verses.ct: The chief priests and the scribes heard about this and began looking for a way to kill him. They were afraid of him because the crowds were amazed by his teaching.

verses.kjv: And when even was come, he went out of the city.
verses.web: When evening came, he went out of the city.
verses.ct: When evening came, Jesus and his disciples left the city.

verses.kjv: And in the morning, as they passed by, they saw the fig tree dried up from the roots.
verses.web: As they passed by in the morning, they saw the fig tree withered away from the roots.
verses.ct: The next morning, as they walked past the fig tree, they saw it had completely withered from the roots up.

verses.kjv: And Peter calling to remembrance saith unto him, Master, behold, the fig tree which thou cursedst is withered away.
verses.web: Peter, remembering, said to him, “Rabbi, look! The fig tree which you cursed has withered away.”
verses.ct: Peter remembered what had happened and said, "Rabbi, look! The fig tree you cursed has completely withered!"

verses.kjv: And Jesus answering saith unto them, Have faith in God.
verses.web: Jesus answered them, “Have faith in God.
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "Have faith in God.

verses.kjv: For verily I say unto you, That whosoever shall say unto this mountain, Be thou removed, and be thou cast into the sea; and shall not doubt in his heart, but shall believe that those things which he saith shall come to pass; he shall have whatsoever he saith.
verses.web: For most certainly I tell you, whoever may tell this mountain, ‘Be taken up and cast into the sea,’ and doesn’t doubt in his heart, but believes that what he says is happening; he shall have whatever he says.
verses.ct: I tell you the truth: if anyone says to this mountain, 'Be lifted up and thrown into the sea,' and doesn't doubt in his heart but truly believes that what he says will happen, it will be done for him.

verses.kjv: Therefore I say unto you, What things soever ye desire, when ye pray, believe that ye receive them, and ye shall have them.
verses.web: Therefore I tell you, all things whatever you pray and ask for, believe that you have received them, and you shall have them.
verses.ct: That's why I'm telling you — whatever you ask for in prayer, believe that you've received it, and it will be yours.

verses.kjv: And when ye stand praying, forgive, if ye have ought against any: that your Father also which is in heaven may forgive you your trespasses.
verses.web: Whenever you stand praying, forgive, if you have anything against anyone; so that your Father, who is in heaven, may also forgive you your transgressions.
verses.ct: And when you stand praying, if you're holding anything against someone, forgive them — so that your Father in heaven will also forgive your sins.

verses.kjv: But if ye do not forgive, neither will your Father which is in heaven forgive your trespasses.
verses.web: But if you do not forgive, neither will your Father in heaven forgive your transgressions.”
verses.ct: But if you refuse to forgive, your Father in heaven won't forgive your sins either."

verses.kjv: And they come again to Jerusalem: and as he was walking in the temple, there come to him the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders,
verses.web: They came again to Jerusalem, and as he was walking in the temple, the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders came to him,
verses.ct: They returned to Jerusalem, and while Jesus was walking through the temple, the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders approached him.

verses.kjv: And say unto him, By what authority doest thou these things? and who gave thee this authority to do these things?
verses.web: and they began saying to him, “By what authority do you do these things? Or who gave you this authority to do these things?”
verses.ct: They demanded, "What authority do you have to do these things? Who gave you this authority?"

verses.kjv: And Jesus answered and said unto them, I will also ask of you one question, and answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.
verses.web: Jesus said to them, “I will ask you one question. Answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.
verses.ct: Jesus said to them, "I'll ask you one question. Answer me, and I'll tell you by what authority I do these things.

verses.kjv: The baptism of John, was it from heaven, or of men? answer me.
verses.web: The baptism of John—was it from heaven, or from men? Answer me.”
verses.ct: John's baptism — was it from heaven, or was it a human invention? Answer me."

verses.kjv: And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say, Why then did ye not believe him?
verses.web: They reasoned with themselves, saying, “If we should say, ‘From heaven;’ he will say, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’
verses.ct: They debated among themselves: "If we say, 'From heaven,' he'll ask, 'Then why didn't you believe him?'

verses.kjv: But if we shall say, Of men; they feared the people: for all men counted John, that he was a prophet indeed.
verses.web: If we should say, ‘From men’ ”—they feared the people, for all held John to really be a prophet.
verses.ct: But if we say, 'A human invention' — " they were afraid of the crowd, because everyone believed John was truly a prophet.

verses.kjv: And they answered and said unto Jesus, We cannot tell. And Jesus answering saith unto them, Neither do I tell you by what authority I do these things.
verses.web: They answered Jesus, “We don’t know.” Jesus said to them, “Neither do I tell you by what authority I do these things.”
verses.ct: So they answered Jesus, "We don't know." Jesus replied, "Then I'm not going to tell you by what authority I do these things either."
